verses.verse: (God’s Reply to the Prophet’s Complaint) (Ps 5.3; 85.8; Isa 21.8, 11) I will stand at my watchpost and station myself on the rampart; I will keep watch to see what he will say to me and what he (Syr: Heb I) will answer concerning my complaint.
(Deut 27.8; Isa 8.1; Rev 1.19) Then the LORD answered me and said: Write the vision; make it plain on tablets, so that a runner may read it.

(Ezek 12.25; Dan 8.17, 19; Heb 10.37, 38) For there is still a vision for the appointed time; it speaks of the end and does not lie. If it seems to tarry, wait for it; it will surely come; it will not delay.
(Rom 1.17; Gal 3.11; Heb 10.37, 38) Look at the proud! Their spirit is not right in them, but the righteous live by their faithfulness.

(2 Kings 14.10; Prov 20.1; 21.24; Jer 25.9) Moreover, wealth (Q mss: MT wine) is treacherous; the arrogant do not endure. They open their throats wide as Sheol; like Death they never have enough. They gather all nations for themselves and collect all peoples as their own.

(The Woes of the Wicked) (v 12|HAB 2:12; Jer 50.13; Ezek 18.7; Am 2.8) Shall not everyone taunt such people and, with mocking riddles, say about them, “Alas for you who heap up what is not your own!” How long will you load yourselves with goods taken in pledge?
Will not your own creditors suddenly rise and those who make you tremble wake up? Then you will be plunder for them.

(v 17|HAB 2:17; Isa 33.1; Zech 2.8) Because you have plundered many nations, all who survive of the peoples shall plunder you— because of human bloodshed and violence to the earth, to cities and all who live in them.
(Jer 22.13; 49.16; Ezek 22.27) “Alas for you who get evil gain for your house, setting your nest on high to be safe from the reach of harm!”
(v 16|HAB 2:16; 2 Kings 9.26; Prov 1.18; Jer 26.19) You have devised shame for your house by cutting off many peoples; you have forfeited your life.
The very stones will cry out from the wall, and the rafter will respond from the woodwork.
(Mic 3.10; Nah 3.1) “Alas for you who build a town by bloodshed and found a city on iniquity!”
Is it not from the LORD of hosts that peoples labor only to feed the flames and nations weary themselves for nothing?
(Isa 11.9; Zech 14.8, 9) But the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.
(Isa 28.7, 8; Hos 7.5) “Alas for you who make your neighbors drink, pouring out your wrath until they are drunk, in order to gaze on their nakedness!”

(v 10|HAB 2:10; Jer 25.15, 27; Lam 4.21; Nah 3.6) You will be sated with contempt instead of glory. Drink, you yourself, and stagger! (Q ms Gk: MT be uncircumcised) The cup in the LORD’s right hand will come around to you, and shame will come upon your glory!

(v 8|HAB 2:8; Jer 51.35; Zech 11.1) For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you; the destruction of the animals will terrify you— (Gk Syr: Heb terrify them) because of human bloodshed and violence to the earth, to cities and all who live in them.

(Ps 115.4, 8; Isa 42.17; Jer 2.27, 28; 10.8, 14; Zech 10.2) What use is an idol once its maker has shaped it— a cast image, a teacher of lies? For its maker trusts in what has been made, though the product is only an idol that cannot speak!

(1 Kings 18.26-29; Ps 135.17; Jer 2.27, 28; 10.9, 14) Alas for you who say to the wood, “Wake up!” to silent stone, “Rouse yourself!” Can it teach? See, it is gold and silver plated, and there is no breath in it at all.
(Mic 1.2; Zeph 1.7; Zech 2.13) But the LORD is in his holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before him!
